unnormalised: Okay, so I was just filling up my scooty at the petrol pump near my house, right? And it got me thinking about all those fuel efficiency ads you see on TV. They’re always talking about kmpl and all that jazz. It’s like, what does it all really mean, you know?
normalised: Okay, so I was just filling up my scooty at the petrol pump near my house, right? And it got me thinking about all those fuel efficiency ads you see on T-V. They’re always talking about kilometer per liter and all that jazz. It’s like, what does it all really mean, you know?

unnormalised: Firstly, what does "kmpl" even mean? I think its kilometer per liter. Like my uncle's old Maruti 800 maybe gave 15 kmpl back in the day. These days, the new cars are saying like 25 kmpl or even 30 kmpl! That's a huge difference right?
normalised: Firstly, what does "kilometer per liter" even mean? I think its kilometer per liter. Like my uncle's old Maruti eight hundred maybe gave fifteen kilometer per liter back in the day. These days, the new cars are saying like twenty five kilometer per liter or even thirty kilometer per liter! That's a huge difference right?

unnormalised: Then there's the whole petrol vs. diesel thing. Diesel cars are supposed to give better mileage, aren't they? But then you hear about all that pollution stuff and BS6 and what not. My cousin bought a Tata Nexon diesel, and he says he gets around 22 kmpl in the city. Pretty decent I guess.
normalised: Then there's the whole petrol versus diesel thing. Diesel cars are supposed to give better mileage, aren't they? But then you hear about all that pollution stuff and B-S six and what not. My cousin bought a Tata Nexon diesel, and he says he gets around twenty two kilometer per liter in the city. Pretty decent I guess.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on CNG! It's supposed to be the super eco-friendly option. I saw an auto-rickshaw driver the other day, saying his CNG kit gives him like 35 kmpl equivalent. That’s seriously impressive, especially considering how much they drive around all day.
normalised: And don't even get me started on C-N-G! It's supposed to be the super eco-friendly option. I saw an auto-rickshaw driver the other day, saying his C-N-G kit gives him like thirty five kilometer per liter equivalent. That’s seriously impressive, especially considering how much they drive around all day.

unnormalised: Now, my scooty is pretty old, but I reckon I get around 40 kmpl on a good day. Of course, that's if I'm not revving the engine like a maniac and stuck in traffic for hours. Then it probably drops down to like 30 kmpl. Ugh, Mumbai traffic!
normalised: Now, my scooty is pretty old, but I reckon I get around forty kilometer per liter on a good day. Of course, that's if I'm not revving the engine like a maniac and stuck in traffic for hours. Then it probably drops down to like thirty kilometer per liter. Ugh, Mumbai traffic!

unnormalised: I also heard that the tyre pressure also affects the fuel efficiency. It seems a little bit low, maybe around 25 PSI? I should probably get that checked. Also, what is the correct tyre pressure? Does anyone know?
normalised: I also heard that the tyre pressure also affects the fuel efficiency. It seems a little bit low, maybe around twenty five P-S-I? I should probably get that checked. Also, what is the correct tyre pressure? Does anyone know?

unnormalised: But seriously, though, fuel efficiency is something we all need to be thinking about, right? With petrol prices going through the roof and all that climate change stuff, every little bit counts. So next time you're at the petrol pump, maybe take a minute to think about your kmpl and how you can squeeze a little more out of every liter.
normalised: But seriously, though, fuel efficiency is something we all need to be thinking about, right? With petrol prices going through the roof and all that climate change stuff, every little bit counts. So next time you're at the petrol pump, maybe take a minute to think about your kilometer per liter and how you can squeeze a little more out of every liter.

unnormalised: Anyway, that’s my fuel efficiency brain dump for the day. Now, back to navigating this crazy traffic! Wish me luck. And remember to drive safely, everyone!
normalised: Anyway, that’s my fuel efficiency brain dump for the day. Now, back to navigating this crazy traffic! Wish me luck. And remember to drive safely, everyone!
